com.saasovation.common.port.adapter.messaging.rabbitmq

Class MessageListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saasovation.common.port.adapter.messaging.rabbitmq.MessageListener

  • public abstract class MessageListener
extends java.lang.Object
    I am a message listener, which is given each message received by a MessageConsumer. I am also an adapter because I provide defaults for both handleMessage() behaviors. A typical subclass would override one or the other handleMessage() based on its type and leave the remaining handleMessage() defaulted since it will never be used by MessageConsumer.

    • Method Detail

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(java.lang.String aType,
                          java.lang.String aMessageId,
                          java.util.Date aTimestamp,
                          byte[] aBinaryMessage,
                          long aDeliveryTag,
                          boolean isRedelivery)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles aBinaryMessage. If any MessageException is thrown by my implementor its isRetry() is examined and, if true, the message being handled will be nack'd and re-queued. Otherwise, if its isRetry() is false the message will be rejected/failed (not re-queued). If any other Exception is thrown the message will be considered not handled and is rejected/failed.
        Parameters:
        aType - the String type of the message if sent, or null
        aMessageId - the String id of the message if sent, or null
        aTimestamp - the Date timestamp of the message if sent, or null
        aBinaryMessage - the byte[] containing the binary message
        aDeliveryTag - the long tag delivered with the message
        isRedelivery - the boolean indicating whether or not this message is a redelivery
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when any problem occurs and the message must not be acknowledged

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(java.lang.String aType,
                          java.lang.String aMessageId,
                          java.util.Date aTimestamp,
                          java.lang.String aTextMessage,
                          long aDeliveryTag,
                          boolean isRedelivery)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles aTextMessage. If any MessageException is thrown by my implementor its isRetry() is examined and, if true, the message being handled will be nack'd and re-queued. Otherwise, if its isRetry() is false the message will be rejected/failed (not re-queued). If any other Exception is thrown the message will be considered not handled and is rejected/failed.
        Parameters:
        aType - the String type of the message if sent, or null
        aMessageId - the String id of the message if sent, or null
        aTimestamp - the Date timestamp of the message if sent, or null
        aTextMessage - the String containing the text message
        aDeliveryTag - the long tag delivered with the message
        isRedelivery - the boolean indicating whether or not this message is a redelivery
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when any problem occurs and the message must not be acknowledged
